item.title: Just wondering about skillcape on my server
item.dc:creator: @shiffed shiffed
item.description:
@shiffed wrote:

kk in item.java u have lines like these

public static int boots[] = {6920,6061,6106,88,89,626,628}

so if u wanted to add the dragon boots, u need to insert the dragon boots code into all the “boots” sections, so u would add 7664 to the end of it and it will look like this,

public static int boots[] = {6920,6061,6106,88,89,626,628,7664}

u see?? that makes it so your server knows where to place the item in ur equipt spots then all you need to view it is an updated client like silab’s client and your ready to mess round with capes

Read full topic

item.title: Just wondering about skillcape on my server
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

I was wondering if I can get skillcapes on my server. because somone on another thread left a code for it and I was wondering if it was real. this is the code:

case 1: // Strength
sendFrame164(6206);
sendFrame126(“Congratulations, you just advanced a strength level!”, 6207);
sendFrame126(“Your strength level is now “+playerLevel[2]+” .”, 6208);
sendMessage(“Congratulations, you just advanced a strength level.”);
if (playerLevel[skill] >= 99) {
sendMessage(“Congratulations on getting Level 99 Strength!”);
addItem(SKILLCAPEID HERE, 1);

so is this the real code or what? and if it is what do I do with it?

Read full topic
item.source: Just wondering about skillcape on my server
